intro: Epilobium alsinoides subsp. atriplicifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It typically grows in moist, sandy or gravelly soils along streambanks and wet meadows. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces spikes of pink to purple flowers. It is a perennial herb with a fibrous root system and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its botanical characteristics make it adaptable to a variety of wetland environments.
